list_definition.definition: a flat piece of wood, metal etc with a low edge, for carrying dishes etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She brought in the tea on a tray

list_ex_of_english: When the trap was not in place, flies deposited their larvae in the trays and were then free to leave.

The trays were placed in a glasshouse and watered regularly.
Levels of relative humidity were maintained within the range of 60-80% by providing free water in trays in the cabinets when necessary.
The trays had continuous slow water flow and exchange.
The water was changed every second day, and trays of cups were rotated systematically to minimize incubator position effects.
Consequently, all the germination experiments reported here used open shaded trays with moist soil as described above.
Specimens then fell into a preserving solution set (containing chloral hydrate) with detergent (to reduce water tension) in aluminium-foil trays positioned beneath the net.
